text.tspan: The number of cases of infectious diseases, World, 1920 to 2017
Smallpox was declared eradicated in 1977, and Guinea worm and polio are on their way to be eradicated. While
yaws and dog-transmitted rabies could be eradicated, it is currently impossible for Malaria, Tuberculosis, and
Source: WHO (2018), Tebbens et al. (2011), IHME (2016)
